article:
'Les Combarelles' is a cave in Les Eyzies de Tayac, Dordogne, France, which was
inhabited by Cro-Magnon people approximately 13â11,000 years ago. Holding more
than 600 pre-historic engravings of animals and symbols, the two galleries in
the cave were crucial in the re-evaluation of the mental and technical
capabilities of these prehistoric humans around the turn of last century. {{cite web
 | title = Les Combarelles url = http://leseyzies-tourist.info/dordogne_tourist_attractions/les-
 | combarelles publisher = Les Eyzies de Tayac Tourist Info date = December 2009
 | | accessdate = May 2011
}}
